data.title: Unable to see some files/folders in visual code explorer

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 Entriprise - Service Pack 1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. I'm running the application in an virtual machine in a restrict access environment.
2. The project is versioned using SVN.

Some files and folders inside the Project Files Panel are not being displayed... I've tried to delete .vscode folders to check whether it was a configuration/cache issue, but nothing I've done has solved the problem. Opening the same project in atom has worked perfectly.

Unfortunately, I can't paste here any log or file, as the Visual Code is running in an restrict environment which I can't extract any file.

data.title: JSON snippets show up twice in package.json intellisense
data.body:
Probably similar to #13835 -
1. Add a JSON snippet. Mine is 

```
"test snippet": {
  "prefix": "test",
  "body": [
    ""
  ],
  "description": "test"
}
```
1. Open package.json, put the cursor in "dependencies"
   - It doesn't repro elsewhere
2. Type "test"
   - If I type fast, I only see the snippet. If I type a little slower, I see the snippet and npm packages, and this is more likely to repro
3. Often see two copies of "test"
4. If not, alt+backspace and type "test" again
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/19816283/83d97a84-9cfb-11e6-8a8a-2224cf259856.png)

Sometimes, I get into a state where I see another instance of "test" added each time I repeat steps 3-5.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/19816460/321a6036-9cfc-11e6-907b-8370c8ea2ebe.png)

It also seems like a bug that when I type "test" quickly, I don't see the npm packages.

data.title: jsdoc typedef (strange behaviour)
data.body:
I cannot autocomplete a property of an object after its first use
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Write this code in a Js file:

```
/**
 * @typedef {Object} My
 * @property {boolean} yes
 */

/**
 * @param {My} my
 */
function a(my) {
    my.yes
}
/**
 * @param {My} my
 */
function b(my) {
    my.
}
```
1. try to autocomplete in the function a. Works fine, as expected
2. try to autocomplete in the function b. It doesn't work at all

data.title: [file icons] Support for extending the file icon theme from an extension

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
It would be nice if extensions could specify custom file icons for the
file types it supports. For visual consistency this could be implemented
to only be used as a fallback if the user's selected theme does not specify
an icon.

data.title: Comment shortcut in SCSS now using CSS style comments
data.body:
In prior releases, using the comment/uncomment shortcut (cmd+/) would add SCSS-style line comments in SCSS files `//`.

In this weeks release, the same key command now uses CSS-style comments `/* */`, which I do not want to use.  The `//` comments are not passed through to the final CSS but the other type is.
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.7.0-insider (1d2d5e089a8261ebb6ad6dfb2e847e5aa1c16f9d, 2016-10-28T11:10:40.281Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.1.0

data.title: editor.action.smartSelect.grow does not work with inputs in the editor
data.body:
- VSCode Version:

```
Version 1.6.1
Commit 9e4e44c19e393803e2b05fe2323cf4ed7e36880e
Date 2016-10-13T15:43:46.054Z
Shell 1.3.7
Renderer 52.0.2743.82
Node 6.5.0
```
- OS Version:

```
Linux ubuntu02 4.4.0-45-generic #66-Ubuntu SMP Wed Oct 19 14:12:37 UTC 2016 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```

Steps to Reproduce:

I have custom mapped "select all" config that seems to break other inputs within the application. I can still "select all" but I have to specifically `ctrl+shift+a`, 

```
    {
        "key": "ctrl+a",
        "command": "editor.action.smartSelect.grow"
    },
    {
        "key": "ctrl+shift+a",
        "command": "editor.action.selectAll"
    }
```

With this configuration `ctrl+a` no longer works in any other inputs within the application. I can still "select all" but I have to specifically `ctrl+shift+a`, 

Using `editor.action.smartSelect.grow` should select all text in inputs (eg: search, replace etc) as the scope would be the entire field. 

Sublime Text 3 works correctly with this setup :/

data.title: EH debugging: after reloading the EH window breakpoints no longer verify
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.0

Steps to Reproduce:
- start EH debugging with launch config that uses the new `outFiles` attribute
- set breakpoint in extension
- reload EH window

Observe: breakpoints no longer verify (become grey)

Problem: on restart VS Code restarts the debug session and only looks for the obsolete `outDir`attribute instead of looking for both `outDir` and `outFiles`.

In December we can remove support for `outDir`.

data.title: Wrong usage of fs.utimes
data.body:
@bpasero Node's documentation says

> The value should be a Unix timestamp in seconds. For example, Date.now() returns milliseconds, so it should be divided by 1000 before passing it in.

You seem to [not be doing that](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/services/files/node/fileService.ts#L327), which could explain the `EPERM`.

Furthermore, [pfs.utimes](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/base/node/pfs.ts#L104) parameters should be `number`, not `Date`.
